# HTML for Kids HTML is like the **instructions for building a webpage**. Imagine you're building with blocksâ€”HTML tells the computer which blocks to use and where to put them. When you visit a website, HTML creates all the stuff you see: the titles, the pictures, the buttons, and the text. It's like the skeleton of a buildingâ€”it holds everything together and gives it shape. ## How HTML Works Think of HTML like a recipe. A recipe says: - First, put in eggs - Then, add flour - Mix it together - Bake at 350 degrees HTML does something similar. It says: - Put a big title here - Put a picture there - Put a paragraph of text below that The computer reads these instructions and shows you the webpage exactly as the HTML describes it. ## Fun Activity 1: Make Your Own Webpage Title Here's a simple HTML example: ```html

My Awesome Website

Welcome to my page!

``` When you put this in HTML, it creates a big title that says "My Awesome Website" and below it shows "Welcome to my page!" Try changing the words and see how it looks! ## Fun Activity 2: HTML Scavenger Hunt Visit any website you like (like a game site or YouTube). Then right-click and choose "View Page Source." You'll see a bunch of HTML code! Try to find words you recognizeâ€”like your favorite game title or a word from the page. All that text you see on the website started as HTML instructions!
